newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan digital satellite TV viewers top 80,000.
newsitem.headline: Japan digital satellite TV viewers top 80,000.

text.p: PerfecTV, Japan's first digital satellite broadcasting company, has gained 81,000 subscribers since the start of services on October 1, the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications said on Tuesday.
About 120,000 receivers were shipped in October alone, the ministry said.
Sales in November and December are expected to total 240,000 receivers, the ministry said.
PerfecTV, owned by a consortium headed by trading company Itochu Corp, now provides 57 TV channels, and five-radio channel services, beamed directly via the JCSAT-3 communications satellite.
The number of TV channels will be increased to 63 next January.
But head-to-head competition with the world's big satellite broadcasters will start in April.
J-SkyB, a joint venture between Australia media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp Ltd and Japan's Softbank Corp, will launch its service in Japan in April and eventually provide 150 TV channels.
Hughes group's DirecTV plans a 100-channel service in the autumn of 1997.
